name: grafana
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing grafana.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`grafana` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/grafana/terraform-provider-grafana).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing grafana.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/grafana/terraform-provider-grafana)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-grafana` repo](https://github.com/pulumiverse/pulumi-grafana/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-grafana` repo](https://github.com/grafana/terraform-provider-grafana/issues).

auth.description:
API token, basic auth in the `username:password` format or `anonymous` (string literal). May alternatively be set via
the `GRAFANA_AUTH` environment variable.

caCert.description:
Certificate CA bundle (file path or literal value) to use to verify the Grafana server's certificate. May alternatively
be set via the `GRAFANA_CA_CERT` environment variable.

cloudApiKey.description:
Access Policy Token (or API key) for Grafana Cloud. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_API_KEY` environment
variable.

cloudApiUrl.description: Grafana Cloud's API URL. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_API_URL` environment variable.

httpHeaders.description:
Optional. HTTP headers mapping keys to values used for accessing the Grafana and Grafana Cloud APIs. May alternatively
be set via the `GRAFANA_HTTP_HEADERS` environment variable in JSON format.

insecureSkipVerify.description: Skip TLS certificate verification. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY` environment variable.

oncallAccessToken.description: A Grafana OnCall access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ONCALL_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

oncallUrl.description: An Grafana OnCall backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ONCALL_URL` environment variable.

orgId.description: Deprecated: Use the `org_id` attributes on resources instead.
orgId.deprecationMessage: Use the `org_id` attributes on resources instead.

retries.description:
The amount of retries to use for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. May alternatively be set via the
`GRAFANA_RETRIES` environment variable.

retryStatusCodes.description:
The status codes to retry on for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. Use `x` as a digit wildcard. Defaults to 429
and 5xx. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_RETRY_STATUS_CODES` environment variable.

retryWait.description:
The amount of time in seconds to wait between retries for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. May alternatively be
set via the `GRAFANA_RETRY_WAIT` environment variable.

smAccessToken.description: A Synthetic Monitoring access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

smUrl.description:
Synthetic monitoring backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_URL` environment variable. The
correct value for each service region is cited in the [Synthetic Monitoring
documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/private-probes/#probe-api-server-url).
Note the `sm_url` value is optional, but it must correspond with the value specified as the `region_slug` in the
`grafana_cloud_stack` resource. Also note that when a Terraform configuration contains multiple provider instances
managing SM resources associated with the same Grafana stack, specifying an explicit `sm_url` set to the same value for
each provider ensures all providers interact with the same SM API.

storeDashboardSha256.description: Set to true if you want to save only the sha256sum instead of complete dashboard model JSON in the tfstate.

tlsCert.description:
Client TLS certificate (file path or literal value) to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be
set via the `GRAFANA_TLS_CERT` environment variable.

tlsKey.description:
Client TLS key (file path or literal value) to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via
the `GRAFANA_TLS_KEY` environment variable.

url.description: The root URL of a Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_URL` environment variable.

selector.description: The label selector to match in metrics or logs query. Should be in PromQL or LogQL format.

customInterval.description:
Custom interval of the report.
**Note:** This field is only available when frequency is set to `custom`.

endTime.description: End time of the report. If empty, the report will be sent indefinitely (according to frequency). Note that times will be saved as UTC in Grafana.

frequency.description: Frequency of the report. Allowed values: `never`, `once`, `hourly`, `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`, `custom`.

lastDayOfMonth.description: Send the report on the last day of the month Defaults to `false`.

startTime.description: Start time of the report. If empty, the start date will be set to the creation time. Note that times will be saved as UTC in Grafana.

workdaysOnly.description: Whether to send the report only on work days. Defaults to `false`.

action.description: Specific action users granted with the role will be allowed to perform (for example: `users:read`)

scope.description: Scope to restrict the action to a set of resources (for example: `users:*` or `roles:customrole1`) Defaults to ``.

annotations.description: Key-value pairs of metadata to attach to the alert rule that may add user-defined context, but cannot be used for matching, grouping, or routing. Defaults to `map[]`.

condition.description: The `ref_id` of the query node in the `data` field to use as the alert condition.

datas.description: A sequence of stages that describe the contents of the rule.

execErrState.description: Describes what state to enter when the rule's query is invalid and the rule cannot be executed. Options are OK, Error, and Alerting. Defaults to `Alerting`.

for.description: The amount of time for which the rule must be breached for the rule to be considered to be Firing. Before this time has elapsed, the rule is only considered to be Pending. Defaults to `0`.

isPaused.description: Sets whether the alert should be paused or not. Defaults to `false`.

labels.description: Key-value pairs to attach to the alert rule that can be used in matching, grouping, and routing. Defaults to `map[]`.

name.description: The name of the alert rule.

noDataState.description: Describes what state to enter when the rule's query returns No Data. Options are OK, NoData, and Alerting. Defaults to `NoData`.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the alert rule.

datasourceUid.description: The UID of the datasource being queried, or "-100" if this stage is an expression stage.

model.description: Custom JSON data to send to the specified datasource when querying.

queryType.description: An optional identifier for the type of query being executed. Defaults to ``.

refId.description: A unique string to identify this query stage within a rule.

relativeTimeRange.description: The time range, relative to when the query is executed, across which to query.

from.description: The number of seconds in the past, relative to when the rule is evaluated, at which the time range begins.

to.description: The number of seconds in the past, relative to when the rule is evaluated, at which the time range ends.

annotations.description: Annotations will be attached to all alerts generated by any of these rules.

labels.description: Labels will be attached to all alerts generated by any of these rules.

slowburns.description: Alerting Rules generated for Slow Burn alerts

annotations.description: Annotations will be attached to all alerts generated by any of these rules.

labels.description: Labels to attach only to Fast Burn alerts.

value.description: Value between 0 and 1. If the value of the query is above the objective, the SLO is met.

window.description: A Prometheus-parsable time duration string like 24h, 60m. This is the time window the objective is measured over.

type.description: Query type must be one of: "freeform", "query", "ratio", or "threshold"

groupByLabels.description: Defines Group By Labels used for per-label alerting. These appear as variables on SLO dashboards to enable filtering and aggregation. Labels must adhere to Prometheus label name schema - "^[a-zA-Z*][a-zA-Z0-9*]*$"

permission.description: Permission to associate with item. Must be `Edit` or `Admin`.

teamId.description: ID of the team to manage permissions for. Specify either this or `user_id`. Defaults to `0`.

userId.description: ID of the user or service account to manage permissions for. Specify either this or `team_id`. Defaults to `0`.

dns.description: Settings for DNS check. The target must be a valid hostname (or IP address for `PTR` records).

http.description: Settings for HTTP check. The target must be a URL (http or https).

ping.description: Settings for ping (ICMP) check. The target must be a valid hostname or IP address.

tcp.description: Settings for TCP check. The target must be of the form `<host>:<port>`, where the host portion must be a valid hostname or IP address.

traceroute.description: Settings for traceroute check. The target must be a valid hostname or IP address

ipVersion.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

server.description: DNS server address to target. Defaults to `8.8.8.8`.

validRCodes.description: List of valid response codes. Options include `NOERROR`, `BADALG`, `BADMODE`, `BADKEY`, `BADCOOKIE`, `BADNAME`, `BADSIG`, `BADTIME`, `BADTRUNC`, `BADVERS`, `FORMERR`, `NOTIMP`, `NOTAUTH`, `NOTZONE`, `NXDOMAIN`, `NXRRSET`, `REFUSED`, `SERVFAIL`, `YXDOMAIN`, `YXRRSET`.

failIfNotMatchesRegexps.description: Fail if value does not match regex.
Fail if value does not match regex.
Fail if value does not match regex.

bearerToken.description: Token for use with bearer authorization header.

body.description: The body of the HTTP request used in probe.

cacheBustingQueryParamName.description: The name of the query parameter used to prevent the server from using a cached response. Each probe will assign a random value to this parameter each time a request is made.

failIfBodyMatchesRegexps.description: List of regexes. If any match the response body, the check will fail.

failIfBodyNotMatchesRegexps.description: List of regexes. If any do not match the response body, the check will fail.

failIfHeaderNotMatchesRegexps.description: Check fails if headers do not match.

failIfNotSsl.description: Fail if SSL is not present. Defaults to `false`.

failIfSsl.description: Fail if SSL is present. Defaults to `false`.

headers.description: The HTTP headers set for the probe.

ipVersion.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

method.description: Request method. One of `GET`, `CONNECT`, `DELETE`, `HEAD`, `OPTIONS`, `POST`, `PUT`, `TRACE` Defaults to `GET`.

noFollowRedirects.description: Do not follow redirects. Defaults to `false`.

validHttpVersions.description: List of valid HTTP versions. Options include `HTTP/1.0`, `HTTP/1.1`, `HTTP/2.0`

validStatusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If unset, defaults to 2xx.

allowMissing.description: Allow header to be missing from responses. Defaults to `false`.

regexp.description: Regex that header value should match.

allowMissing.description: Allow header to be missing from responses. Defaults to `false`.

regexp.description: Regex that header value should match.

insecureSkipVerify.description: Disable target certificate validation. Defaults to `false`.

serverName.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

dontFragment.description: Set the DF-bit in the IP-header. Only works with ipV4. Defaults to `false`.

ipVersion.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

queryResponses.description: The query sent in the TCP probe and the expected associated response.

tls.description: Whether or not TLS is used when the connection is initiated. Defaults to `false`.

startTls.description: Upgrade TCP connection to TLS. Defaults to `false`.

insecureSkipVerify.description: Disable target certificate validation. Defaults to `false`.

serverName.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

maxHops.description: Maximum TTL for the trace Defaults to `64`.

maxUnknownHops.description: Maximum number of hosts to travers that give no response Defaults to `15`.

ptrLookup.description: Reverse lookup hostnames from IP addresses Defaults to `true`.

provider.description:
The provider type for the grafana package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

auth.description:
API token, basic auth in the `username:password` format or `anonymous` (string literal). May alternatively be set via
the `GRAFANA_AUTH` environment variable.

caCert.description:
Certificate CA bundle (file path or literal value) to use to verify the Grafana server's certificate. May alternatively
be set via the `GRAFANA_CA_CERT` environment variable.

cloudApiKey.description:
Access Policy Token (or API key) for Grafana Cloud. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_API_KEY` environment
variable.

cloudApiUrl.description: Grafana Cloud's API URL. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_API_URL` environment variable.

insecureSkipVerify.description: Skip TLS certificate verification. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY` environment variable.

oncallAccessToken.description: A Grafana OnCall access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ONCALL_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

oncallUrl.description: An Grafana OnCall backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ONCALL_URL` environment variable.

orgId.description: Deprecated: Use the `org_id` attributes on resources instead.
orgId.deprecationMessage: Use the `org_id` attributes on resources instead.

retries.description:
The amount of retries to use for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. May alternatively be set via the
`GRAFANA_RETRIES` environment variable.

retryStatusCodes.description:
The status codes to retry on for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. Use `x` as a digit wildcard. Defaults to 429
and 5xx. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_RETRY_STATUS_CODES` environment variable.

retryWait.description:
The amount of time in seconds to wait between retries for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. May alternatively be
set via the `GRAFANA_RETRY_WAIT` environment variable.

smAccessToken.description: A Synthetic Monitoring access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

smUrl.description:
Synthetic monitoring backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_URL` environment variable. The
correct value for each service region is cited in the [Synthetic Monitoring
documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/private-probes/#probe-api-server-url).
Note the `sm_url` value is optional, but it must correspond with the value specified as the `region_slug` in the
`grafana_cloud_stack` resource. Also note that when a Terraform configuration contains multiple provider instances
managing SM resources associated with the same Grafana stack, specifying an explicit `sm_url` set to the same value for
each provider ensures all providers interact with the same SM API.

storeDashboardSha256.description: Set to true if you want to save only the sha256sum instead of complete dashboard model JSON in the tfstate.

tlsCert.description:
Client TLS certificate (file path or literal value) to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be
set via the `GRAFANA_TLS_CERT` environment variable.

tlsKey.description:
Client TLS key (file path or literal value) to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via
the `GRAFANA_TLS_KEY` environment variable.

url.description: The root URL of a Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_URL` environment variable.

grafana:index/machineLearningHoliday:Mac.description:
A holiday describes time periods where a time series is expected to behave differently to normal.

To use a holiday in a job, use its id in the `holidays` attribute of a `grafana.MachineLearningJob`:

customPeriods.description: A list of custom periods for the holiday.

icalTimezone.description: The timezone to use for events in the iCal file pointed to by ical_url.

icalUrl.description: A URL to an iCal file containing all occurrences of the holiday.

name.description: The name of the custom period.

customPeriods.description: A list of custom periods for the holiday.

grafana:index/machineLearningOutlierDete.description:
An outlier detector monitors the results of a query and reports when its values are outside normal bands.

The normal band is configured by choice of algorithm, its sensitivity and other configuration.

Visit https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/machine-learning/outlier-detection/ for more details.

algorithm.description: The algorithm to use and its configuration. See https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/machine-learning/outlier-detection/ for details.

datasourceId.description: The id of the datasource to query.

datasourceType.description: The type of datasource being queried. Currently allowed values are prometheus, graphite, loki, postgres, and datadog.

datasourceUid.description: The uid of the datasource to query.

description.description: A description of the outlier detector.

interval.description: The data interval in seconds to monitor. Defaults to `300`.

metric.description: The metric used to query the outlier detector results.

name.description: The name of the algorithm to use ('mad' or 'dbscan').

queryParams.description: An object representing the query params to query Grafana with.

adminUser.description:
The login name of the configured default admin user for the Grafana installation. If unset, this value defaults to
admin, the Grafana default. Grafana adds the default admin user to all organizations automatically upon creation, and
this parameter keeps Terraform from removing it from organizations.

admins.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given admin
access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in
Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

createUsers.description:
Whether or not to create Grafana users specified in the organization's
membership if they don't already exist in Grafana. If unspecified, this
parameter defaults to true, creating placeholder users with the name, login,
and email set to the email of the user, and a random password. Setting this
option to false will cause an error to be thrown for any users that do not
already exist in Grafana.
Defaults to `true`.

grafana:index/sLO:SLO.description:
Resource manages Grafana SLOs. 

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/alerting-and-irm/slo/)
* [API documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/alerting-and-irm/slo/api/)
* [Additional Information On Alerting Rule Annotations and Labels](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/alerting_rules/#templating/)

{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}
### Basic

```java
package generated_program;

import com.pulumi.Context;
import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
import com.pulumi.core.Output;
import com.pulumi.grafana.SLO;
import com.pulumi.grafana.SLOArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOAlertingArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOLabelArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOObjectiveArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOQueryArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOQueryFreeformArgs;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Map;
import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        var test = new SLO("test", SLOArgs.builder()        
            .alertings(SLOAlertingArgs.builder()
                .fastburns(SLOAlertingFastburnArgs.builder()
                    .annotation(                    
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference),
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference))
                    .build())
                .slowburns(SLOAlertingSlowburnArgs.builder()
                    .annotation(                    
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference),
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference))
                    .build())
                .build())
            .description("Terraform Description")
            .labels(SLOLabelArgs.builder()
                .key("slo")
                .value("terraform")
                .build())
            .objectives(SLOObjectiveArgs.builder()
                .value(0.995)
                .window("30d")
                .build())
            .queries(SLOQueryArgs.builder()
                .freeform(SLOQueryFreeformArgs.builder()
                    .query("sum(rate(apiserver_request_total{code!=\"500\"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum(rate(apiserver_request_total[$__rate_interval]))")
                    .build())
                .type("freeform")
                .build())
            .build());

    }
}
```
```yaml
resources:
  test:
    type: grafana:SLO
    properties:
      alertings:
        - fastburns:
            - annotation:
                - key: name
                  value: SLO Burn Rate Very High
                - key: description
                  value: Error budget is burning too fast
          slowburns:
            - annotation:
                - key: name
                  value: SLO Burn Rate High
                - key: description
                  value: Error budget is burning too fast
      description: Terraform Description
      labels:
        - key: slo
          value: terraform
      objectives:
        - value: 0.995
          window: 30d
      queries:
        - freeform:
            query: sum(rate(apiserver_request_total{code!="500"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum(rate(apiserver_request_total[$__rate_interval]))
          type: freeform
```

```java
package generated_program;

import com.pulumi.Context;
import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
import com.pulumi.core.Output;
import com.pulumi.grafana.SLO;
import com.pulumi.grafana.SLOArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOAlertingArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOLabelArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOObjectiveArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOQueryArgs;
import com.pulumi.grafana.inputs.SLOQueryRatioArgs;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Map;
import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        var test = new SLO("test", SLOArgs.builder()        
            .alertings(SLOAlertingArgs.builder()
                .fastburns(SLOAlertingFastburnArgs.builder()
                    .annotation(                    
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference),
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference))
                    .label(%!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference))
                    .build())
                .slowburns(SLOAlertingSlowburnArgs.builder()
                    .annotation(                    
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference),
                        %!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference))
                    .label(%!v(PANIC=Format method: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference))
                    .build())
                .build())
            .description("Complex Resource - Terraform Ratio Query Description")
            .labels(SLOLabelArgs.builder()
                .key("slo")
                .value("terraform")
                .build())
            .objectives(SLOObjectiveArgs.builder()
                .value(0.995)
                .window("30d")
                .build())
            .queries(SLOQueryArgs.builder()
                .ratio(SLOQueryRatioArgs.builder()
                    .groupByLabels(                    
                        "job",
                        "instance")
                    .successMetric("kubelet_http_requests_total{status!~\"5..\"}")
                    .totalMetric("kubelet_http_requests_total")
                    .build())
                .type("ratio")
                .build())
            .build());

    }
}
```

alertings.description:
Configures the alerting rules that will be generated for each
			time window associated with the SLO. Grafana SLOs can generate
			alerts when the short-term error budget burn is very high, the
			long-term error budget burn rate is high, or when the remaining
			error budget is below a certain threshold. Annotations and Labels support templating.

description.description: Description is a free-text field that can provide more context to an SLO.

labels.description: Labels to attach only to Fast Burn alerts.

name.description: Name should be a short description of your indicator. Consider names like "API Availability"

objectives.description: Over each rolling time window, the remaining error budget will be calculated, and separate alerts can be generated for each time window based on the SLO burn rate or remaining error budget.
